lines.text:
[trying to get out of a Ferrari GT Spider without revealing too much leg]
A girl has trouble getting out of these things...
Yes, I think the Italians designed them that way.
Listen, buster, this is modern day England, you can't get away with knocking off Herman!
But that's what makes the whole thing so delightful, we can!

[Lily and Grandpa are 'borrowing' a couple of horses]
Grandpa, what if we get caught?
Listen, it won't be the first time I was hanged as a horse thief.
"Car 54, Where Are You?" - when finally discovering the secret of Munster Hall.
I want to go to the party and put on funny hats and be obnoxious and talk too loud and get stoned- uphold the American image abroad.
Uncle Cavanaugh? I didn't know there were any English Munsters.
Marilyn dear, no matter where you go in the world, you can always dig up one of our relatives.
Marilyn, if you should happen to meet any strange men on board, be sure and speak to them.
That's right, dear. Don't let your... unatractiveness make you self conscious.
Mom, how come pop inherited an English title? I thought he was made in Germany.
Well you see, Eddie, at an early age, your father left doctor Frankenstein's lab in Germany...

[Herman puts a monocle over his eye and looks in the mirror, which promptly shatters]
That's right, son.
...and then he arrived in England and he was adopted by a family called Munster, who gave him their name.

[to Marylin]
Since you got to be an old lady of nineteen, you don't wanna have any fun at all!
Really children. Last night couldn't have been more badly bungled if I had given it to parliament to do.
Can I get you a bite of breakfast, governor?
Oh, thank you very much, Cruikshank, eh, but I am not a governor. I never even made Alderman.
[chuckles]
Lord.
Mumsy, Freddy is bashing his head against the wall and if he opens a vein it will ruin the drapes.
What's the matter with you two blokes? I've seen zombies at the flickers looking 'appier than you two.
By the way, where's my darling mumsy?
I don't know. I don't understand her missing this, she so enjoys a good killing.
Let's bash him on the head with something jagged.
Let's bash him on the cranium with something jagged.
Goodbye Spot, don't eat anybody till we get back!
Did ya hear that?
I saw a movie once where a dog howled like that and the next thing you know, he turned back into Lon Chaney, Jr.
I say, I say, you must tell me something. Did you just hideous giant with a ghastly green face?
I see them all the time, friend, all the time.
Herman, I must ask Freddie where he gets his slime. It looks imported.
Mumsy, let me do him in, pretty please?
He shall be done in, but according to the Griffin's prearranged plan.
Oh! Freddie Munster, you're not a very nice person!
I am a thorough rotter. Like all the Musters before me, and proud of it!
I hope those guys didn't bring any more to-mah-tos

[still wondering about the identity of 'The Griffin']
By jove, I've got it! It's Cruikshank's! You know, whenever the Americans make a picture about the British, it's always the butler!
